title: Transfer Learning and Multi-Task Learning-Based Language Instructional Design for Autonomous Optical Network Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Foundations of neural networks, basic reinforcement learning concepts, understanding of optical network architectures, and experience in technical documentation and analytical report writing
context.additional_context: Learners participate in practical sessions using personal devices and are evaluated on their ability to apply real network scenarios through project-based assessments. Key evaluation criteria include clear linguistic expression of experimental results, data interpretation skills, and systematic report writing.

learning_goals: Learners design knowledge transfer models between ≥3 network status datasets (e.g., traffic patterns, latency, packet loss rates) using transfer learning techniques (fine-tuning, feature extraction). They submit technical reports meeting ≥2 of the predefined metrics (accuracy ≥80%, F1-score ≥0.75).

Develop agents that simultaneously handle routing, modulation, spectrum allocation (RMSA), and anycast service tasks via multi-task learning and linguistically express task-specific performance analysis results.

Within 4 weeks, learners implement a hierarchical processing structure separating global state and task-specific state data for modular DRL agent design. They apply this to ≥3 task scenarios in OpenAI Gym, achieve ≥80% task success rates, and systematically document experimental results.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
